ngCl***REMOVED***
directive in module ng

Description

The ngCl***REMOVED*** allows you to set CSS cl***REMOVED***es on HTML an element, dynamically, by databinding an expression that represents all cl***REMOVED***es to be added.

The directive won't add duplicate cl***REMOVED***es if a particular cl***REMOVED*** was already set.

When the expression changes, the previously added cl***REMOVED***es are removed and only then the new cl***REMOVED***es are added.

Usage

as attribute
<ANY ng-cl***REMOVED***="{expression}">
   ...
</ANY>
as cl***REMOVED***
<ANY cl***REMOVED***="ng-cl***REMOVED***: {expression};">
   ...
</ANY>

Animations

  • add - happens just before the cl***REMOVED*** is applied to the element
  • remove - happens just before the cl***REMOVED*** is removed from the element
Click here to learn more about the steps involved in the animation.

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
ngCl***REMOVED***expression

Expression to eval. The result of the evaluation can be a string representing space delimited cl***REMOVED*** names, an array, or a map of cl***REMOVED*** names to boolean values. In the case of a map, the names of the properties whose values are truthy will be added as css cl***REMOVED***es to the element.

ngCl***REMOVED*** and pre-existing CSS3 Transitions/Animations


The ngCl***REMOVED*** directive still supports CSS3 Transitions/Animations even if they do not follow the ngAnimate CSS naming structure.
Therefore, if any CSS3 Transition/Animation styles (outside of ngAnimate) are set on the element, then, if a ngCl***REMOVED*** animation
is triggered, the ngCl***REMOVED*** animation will be skipped so that ngAnimate can allow for the pre-existing transition or animation to
take over. This restriction allows for ngCl***REMOVED*** to still work with standard CSS3 Transitions/Animations that are defined
outside of ngAnimate.
